item.title: Personal VPN setup
item.description: If you are interested in computers, technology, programming or hacking, there has been probably at least one time when you’ve wondered what would be the most secure and affordable VPN that you can get. Most times you end up using a third-party service such as (but not limited to) Mullvad or ProtonVPN, which are great solutions. Most times you get multiple VPN servers in multiple countries. I’ve used NordVPN, ProtonVPN and some others, but unfortunately the servers are most often blocked in public Wi-Fis (for questionable purposes), which is ridiculous.
